data.value: What is the penalty for intentionally and illegally blocking a score ?

data.value: A helpless receiver is defined as a receiver who is in the process of catching a ball that is in the air.

data.value: What is a penalty a charge or tackle on a helpless receiver ?

data.name: QuestionContactWhenKOText
data.value: What is the penalty for making an illegal contact while knocked out ?

data.name: QuestionCorrectingIllegalSetPlayerAnswer1
data.value: The team must change as few players as possible

data.name: QuestionCorrectingIllegalSetPlayerAnswer2
data.value: The team may change any number of player, as ling as this result in a legal set of players

data.name: QuestionCorrectingIllegalSetPlayerAnswer3
data.value: The team cannot change players immediatly, but must sub players as soon as the game restart

data.name: QuestionCorrectingIllegalSetPlayerText
data.value: What of the following is true when correcting an illegal set of player ?

data.name: QuestionDangerousKickText
data.value: What is the penalty for a dangerous kick or a kick to an opponent ?

data.name: QuestionDeadQuafflePlayText
data.value: What is the penalty for illegaly acting on a dead quaffle ?

data.name: QuestionDecliningCatchAnswer1
data.value: A team may decline any snitch catch

data.name: QuestionDecliningCatchAnswer2
data.value: The catch can be just after a goal and before the referee confirmed the goal as good

data.name: QuestionDecliningCatchAnswer3
data.value: The catch occured after a goal event (good or otherwise), and before the referee adjust his call for this event

data.name: QuestionDecliningCatchAnswer4
data.value: The change in score must change whether the catch would end the period in a tie

data.name: QuestionDecliningCatchText
data.value: What of the following are true for a team that wants to decline a snitch catch ?

data.name: QuestionDefBlueCardsText
data.value: Which of the followings are true for a blue card call ?

data.name: QuestionDefBlueCardsAnswer1
data.value: A second blue card is upgraded to a yellow card

data.name: QuestionDefBlueCardsAnswer2
data.value: Any ball acted upon or prevented to get by the fouling player is turned over

data.name: QuestionDefBlueCardsAnswer3
data.value: Quaffle is turned over

data.name: QuestionDefBlueCardsAnswer4
data.value: Player is released after a minute

data.name: QuestionDefBlueCardsAnswer5
data.value: Player is released after getting scored

data.name: QuestionDefRedCardsAnswer1
data.value: Any ball acted upon or prevented to get by the fouling player is turned over

data.name: QuestionDefRedCardsAnswer2
data.value: Quaffle is turned over

data.name: QuestionDefRedCardsAnswer3
data.value: A Player is released after a minute

data.name: QuestionDefRedCardsAnswer4
data.value: A Player is released after two minutes

data.name: QuestionDefRedCardsAnswer5
data.value: A Player is released after getting scored

data.name: QuestionDefRedCardsExplanation
data.value: Since the red carded player may not play the match again, it is a different player that must go into the penalty box and be released.

data.name: QuestionDefRedCardsText
data.value: Which of the followings are true for a red card call ?

data.name: QuestionDefYellowCardsAnswer1
data.value: A second yellow card is upgraded to a red card

data.name: QuestionDefYellowCardsAnswer2
data.value: Any ball acted upon or prevented to get by the fouling player is turned over

data.name: QuestionDefYellowCardsAnswer3
data.value: Quaffle is turned over

data.name: QuestionDefYellowCardsAnswer4
data.value: Player is released after a minute

data.name: QuestionDefYellowCardsAnswer5
data.value: Player is released after getting scored

data.name: QuestionDefYellowCardsText
data.value: Which of the followings are true for a yellow card call ?

data.value: No penalty

data.name: QuestionFailSendSeekerAnswer2

data.value: What is the penalty for entering play with illegally long or sharp fingernails ?

data.value: What is the penalty for the repeated use of explicit or vulgar language ?

data.value: What is the penalty for propelling a ball with the intent of sending any ball out of bounds ?

data.name: QuestionStandardContactPenaltyAnswer1
data.value: This penalty may be reduced

data.name: QuestionStandardContactPenaltyAnswer2
data.value: This penalty may be augmented

data.name: QuestionStandardContactPenaltyExplanation
data.value: The penalty shall be reduced to a back to hoops if the fouling player immediatly correct his position, and augmented to a red card if the play was egregious.

data.name: QuestionStandardContactPenaltyText
data.value: What is the penalty for a standard contact violation ?

data.value: What is the penalty for a struck beater violation

data.name: QuestionSubstitutionViolationAnswer1
data.value: Repeat procedure

data.name: QuestionSubstitutionViolationExplanation
data.value: A substitution violation is defined as an illegal substitution that did not affect play yet.

data.name: QuestionSubstitutionViolationText
data.value: What is the penalty for a substitution violation ?

data.name: QuestionTeamPenaltyAnswer1
data.value: The team must play with fewer than the necessary amount of player

data.name: QuestionTeamPenaltyAnswer2
data.value: The team must forfeit

data.name: QuestionTeamPenaltyExplanation
data.value: This is also true if the team has more than 7 players, but cannot respect the 4-maximum rule.

data.name: QuestionTeamPenaltyText
data.value: What happens when a team falls below the necessary number of player during a game ?

data.name: QuestionThirdBludgerInterferenceAnswer1
data.value: Double bludger turnover

data.name: QuestionThirdBludgerInterferenceText
data.value: What is the penalty for a third bludger interference ?

data.name: QuestionTurnoverWhenNoElligibleAnswer1
data.value: The ball is placed at the hoops of the fouled team

data.name: QuestionTurnoverWhenNoElligibleAnswer2
data.value: The ball is unplayable until the fouled team plays it

data.name: QuestionTurnoverWhenNoElligibleAnswer3
data.value: The turnover is cancelled

data.name: QuestionTurnoverWhenNoElligibleText
data.value: What happens when a turnover is called, but no elligible player may receive the turned-over ball ?

data.value: What is the penalty for an unsportsmanlike conduct ?

data.name: QuestionUseIllegalEquipmentAnswer1
data.value: The player must sub and correct his equipment before entering play

data.name: QuestionUseIllegalEquipmentText
data.value: What is the penalty for playing with an illegal equipment ?

data.name: QuestionUseSpecificalIllegalEquipmentAnswer1
data.value: The player must sub and correct his equipment before entering play

data.name: QuestionUseSpecificalIllegalEquipmentText
data.value: What is the penalty for using an equipment that was specified as illegal by the tournament organisator ?

data.name: QuestionViolentContactText
data.value: What is the penalty for a reckless contact ?

data.name: QuestionViolentKickText
data.value: What is the penalty for a violent or egregious kick ?

data.name: QuestionYellowDuringAdvantageAnswer1
data.value: The player goes to the penalty box

data.name: QuestionYellowDuringAdvantageAnswer2
data.value: The player must go back to hoops

data.name: QuestionYellowDuringAdvantageAnswer3
data.value: The player keeps playing

data.name: QuestionYellowDuringAdvantageExplanation
data.value: Since the foul happened before the score, it would have released the player. In this case, the player is not sent to the penalty box and keeps playing.

data.name: QuestionYellowDuringAdvantageText
data.value: A player do a blue or yellow card offense causing an advantage. After the fouled team scores, the referee gives the card to the player.

data.name: RedCard
data.value: Red card

data.name: Turnover
data.value: Turnover

data.name: YellowCard
data.value: Yellow card

data.name: QuestionTeamCompositionText
data.value: What is the lower and upper limit of the number of player in a team ?

data.name: QuestionThirdBludgerInterferenceExplanation
data.value: One of the turned over bludger should usually be the one that was on the ground.
